file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 20-30-02-02 - LUBRICANTS OILS AND GREASES - MAINTENANCE PRACTICES

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL LUBRICANTS OILS AND GREASES - MAINTENANCE PRACTICES EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This subchapter gives a list of the products approved to be used on, and for the servicing of, the aircraft, with their most usual suppliers. B. For the correct procedure to use the products, and for filling, charging, lubrication, or other applications, refer to the chapters shown in the table that follows. C. Unless specified differently by the component manufacturer, MIL-, FED. SPEC., products of different brands must not be mixed. D. Possible alternative products are opposite the same group of chapters where the indicated product(s) is(are) referenced to. E. Products on the QPL (Qualified Products List) for specifications MIL referred to in this subchapter are automatically approved to be used on the aircraft. F. The supplier/manufacturer addresses are given in section AMM MPP 20-30-00/200. G. The signal "-" in the SPECIFICATION column of the table means that no specification is available for the related product. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 20-30-02 Page 1 of 7 Rev 55 - Oct 29/18 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL LUBRICANTS OILS AND GREASES - MAINTENANCE PRACTICES EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. List of the Products Approved to Be Used on the Aircraft A. The table that follows gives the Engine Lubricants approved to be used on the aircraft. Table 201 - ENGINE LUBRICANTS TO USE, REFER TO MAIN- SUPPLIER/ SPECIFICATION COMMERCIAL PRODUCT TENANCE MANUAL MANUFACTURER INDICATION Aeroshell / Royco Shell / Royal Turbine Oil 500 Lubricants BPTO 2380 Air BP Lubricants MIL-PRF-23699 STD ETO 2380 Eastman Lubricants Mobil Jet II Mobil 12-12-01 Turbonycoil TN 600 Nyco Mobil Jet Oil 254 Mobil MIL-PRF-23699 HTS BPTO 2197 Air BP Lubricants ETO 2197 Eastman Lubricants MIL-PRF-7808 Mobil RM 284A Mobil NOTE: • Fill the Air Turbine Starter Oil Tanks with the same oil as that approved for the engine. Refer to AMM TASK 80-10-01-600-801-A/300). • Refer to the latest revision of Rolls-Royce Maintenance Manual CSP34022 for the recommendations about mixture of engine oil of different brands. B. The table that follows gives the Auxiliary Power Unit Lubricants approved to be used on the aircraft.
